alert.note: Alert for Butler; Conecuh; Covington; Crenshaw; Escambia (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued October 18 at 3:18AM CDT until October 18 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A RED FLAG WARNING IS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHERN MOBILE AND BALDWIN COUNTIES IN ALABAMA, THE WESTERN FLORIDA PANHANDLE, AND PARTS OF INTERIOR SOUTH CENTRAL ALABAMA DUE TO A COMBINATION OF LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES, 20 FOOT WINDS AROUND 15 MPH, AND HIGH ERC AND KBDI VALUES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR PARTS OF INTERIOR SOUTH CENTRAL ALABAMA... The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 7 PM CDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 056, 057, 058, 059 and 060. * WINDS...North around 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
